Pre-Game Insights: Afghanistan's bowlers will ask questions, and India's batters must answer them
Rashid Khan and Fazalhaq Farooqi could be Afghanistan's trump cards, while India could counter them with Suryakumar Yadav and Shivam Dube
India have Suryakumar Yadav, who has dominated Rashid in T20s, scoring 86 runs in 58 balls at a strike rate of 148 without being dismissed
Rashid has not done as well against left-hand batters in T20s lately, keeping them down to a strike rate of 109 in 2022 and 2023, compared to 141 this year
Afghanistan's bowling is their best strength, but India have them covered, meaning one of Afghanistan's batters will have to have a field day
Rahmanullah Gurbaz and Axar Patel are in the spotlight, with Gurbaz scoring 80 off 56 balls in a match where only two of his team-mates reached double-digits and the opposition was bowled out for 75
Axar Patel's left-arm spin is all about containment, but he does that by attacking the stumps, while his batting at No. 8 gives India the confidence to hit out from ball one
Afghanistan have only two left-hand batters in their top eight
Miscellaneous Highlights: Afghanistan's bowling attack capable of asking questions every over
Rashid Khan has finished off situations where the opposition has just started to wobble
Bridgetown has offered decent batting conditions
Afghanistan have played India in 13 games across formats, but are yet to win one
Gurbaz (167) and Farooqi (12) are currently the highest scorer and the highest wicket-taker, respectively, in the T20 World Cup 2024
India have not faced Rashid a lot in T20Is, but in two games, they have scored 69 runs in eight overs without losing a single wicket to him
